intro: Siphoneranthemum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered siphoneranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, featuring small, clustered flowers that are often yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged in fascicles, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Siphoneranthemum fasciculatum is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
